Description: Six joining fragments of rim and floor of a large North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; low, rounded ring foot; offset on floor near join with foot; curving rim. On rim, maeander frieze between bands; on floor part of animal frieze sporadically preserved: sphinx (rather than siren to to judge from available space), horn of goat, head of lion looking back. Underside of rim glazed with one reserved band; foot glazed; underside of floor reserved. Graffito inscription on outside of rim.
Curator's comments: From same vessel as 1888,0601.395*b-c. It is not clear to which pot the similar text mentioned in CR 1893 83, no. II refers, if indeed it is still in the Muiseum.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 242, no. 6)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 65, no. 777, pl. XXI, no. 777)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 684, no. 428, pl. 28.2)
Johnston 1974 / Naukratis: more light, no SON (p. 97)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.795)
